Step 2: Build a ligand–receptor (LR) table and compute LR scores

Source: R/get_ChimeLRscore.R
get_ChimeLRscore.Rd

Select LR interactions from CellChatDB and compute LR scores as the sum of VST-transformed ligand and receptor values for matched samples.

Usage

get_ChimeLRscore(
  combined,
  direction = c("mouse_ligand_human_receptor", "human_ligand_mouse_receptor"),
  db_scope = c("secreted", "contact", "ecm"),
  rename_to_mouse = FALSE,
  ortholog_map = NULL,
  rename_mode = c("compact", "one")
)

Arguments

combined

A numeric matrix (rows = human gene symbols) returned by run_ChimeDB().

direction

Direction of scoring: "mouse_ligand_human_receptor" or "human_ligand_mouse_receptor".

db_scope

Character vector of any of c("secreted","contact","ecm") to select CellChatDB categories.

rename_to_mouse

Logical; if TRUE, convert the mouse-side gene names for display.

ortholog_map

A list or data.frame used to map human-to-mouse names (typically run_ChimeDB()$ortholog_map).

rename_mode

Display mode when multiple orthologs exist: "one" (first only) or "compact" (first plus “+n more”).

Value

A tibble with columns:

direction

Scoring direction.

ligand

Ligand gene symbol.

receptor

Receptor gene symbol.

score

Sum of VST-transformed ligand and receptor values.

condition

Condition label (Control/Treatment).

sample

Sample identifier.

pair_human

Pair shown with human symbols on both sides.

pair

Display pair, with one side renamed to mouse symbols if requested.
